title: O.M.B.
content:
coming soon

Sintel is an independently produced short film, initiated by the Blender Foundation as a means to further improve and validate the free/open source 3D creation suite Blender. With initial funding provided by 1000s of donations via the internet community, it has again proven to be a viable development model for both open 3D technology as for independent animation film. This 15 minute film has been realized in the studio of the Amsterdam Blender Institute, by an international team of artists and developers. In addition to that, several crucial technical and creative targets have been realized online, by developers and artists and teams all over the world - www.sintel.org

title: UFA V forum - Fallout theme
titlettemple: Web design, web developed, restyle logo and other
content:
"Fallout is a series of post-apocalyptic role-playing video games and later action role-playing games created by Interplay Entertainment. The series is set during the 21st, 22nd and 23rd centuries, and its atompunk retrofuturistic setting and art work are influenced by the post-war culture of 1950s United States, with its combination of hope for the promises of technology and the lurking fear of nuclear annihilation. A forerunner of Fallout is Wasteland, a 1988 game developed by Interplay Productions to which the series is regarded as a spiritual successor." - wikipedia.org

Software: Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop, Visual Studio Code, Denwer, Proboards tools

working process

Create signature and icons (Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop)

Create "header" for forum page (Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop)

Create prototype "header" for forum page. Coding: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP (Visual Studio Code, Denwer)

"Humanity is so resilient, to cling to life despite all of this"

- Fallout (video game)

final result

Home page (music player, navigation, autorisation, date & time, news and other components)

Other pages (profile, search, calendar, messages and other)

title: Theatre ATX
titlettemple: Web design, web developed, restyle logo and other
content:
"Theatre ATX (Academy of Theater Arts) - was founded in Russia, Saratov City on November 20, 1988. The first (and only) president (artistic director) of the "Academy" Ivan Ivanovich Verkhovykh, a graduate of the acting department of the I.A. Slonov and the directing department of the Higher Theater School named after B.V. Shchukin. While still an actor of the Saratov Youth Theater, he created three theater studios in Saratov, from which the theater arose over time: eight of the then studio members became a kind of core of the team." - Theatre ATX

Target: The main idea was to create a website that would look like it was made in the early 2000s, using the tools and techniques that were available at that time. I wanted to recreate the aesthetic and functionality of websites from that era, such as the use of frames, tables, animated GIFs, marquees, pop-ups, and so on.

Software: Denwer, Visual Studio Code, CMS Joomla, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop

working process

Restyle logo (convert to vector, color correction and add text)

"Свобода станет законом, а закон свободой. Ты вернешься и никогда не будешь рабом. ни ты, ни твои дети"

- И. Верховых (Theatre ATX)

final result

The theater's style is influenced by Suprematism and Bauhaus, two artistic movements that emphasized geometric shapes, colors and functionality. I incorporated some elements from these movements into the site design, such as the use of black, white and yellow, the contrast between straight and curved lines, and the balance between form and content. The site has a retro feel, but also a modern touch. It showcases the theater's history, vision and performances in a clear and engaging way.

Home page (autorisation, navigation, slider, posters, news)

Photo archive - categories (gallery)

Photo archive - open categorie (gallery)

Contact (contact form)

Authors (categories)

About (History of Theatre ATX)

Artistic director and actors

Photos are taken from the official website of Theatre ATX

title: Spheres - Nature elements
titlettemple: VR-360° video content for LED Media Spheres
content:
"...The architects preferred not to continue the idea of green facades in the interior literally - at the expense of living plants. Therefore, the eco-theme is embodied here by figurative means. The project is based on the idea of biomes (biological environments such as, for example, desert, tundra, ocean, etc.). At the entrance of the building, screen balls are placed under the ceiling, which broadcast 360 degrees of environmental content specially created for the project (each ball has its own biome)." - UNK corporate interiors

Target: Creating video content on the topic of "natural elements" in 360° (VR) format. This would be a great way to showcase the beauty and diversity of nature, as well as to provide an immersive and educational experience for the viewers.
The project would involve using software such as "Blender", "After Effects" and "Premiere" to create realistic and stunning 3D models and animations of various natural elements, such as water, fire, earth, and air.
The final product would be compatible with VR devices and platforms, such as LED Media-Spheres.

Software: Blender, Adobe After Effects, Adobe Premiere, Adobe Photoshop

working process

Customer-approved options 3D spheres

Create 3D spheres with procedural textures and geometry nodes technologies

Render looped animation in VR 360° video format

Blender - Media LED Spheres in 3D interior

"..At the entrance of the building, screen balls are placed under the ceiling, which broadcast 360° of environmental content.."

- UNK corporate interiors

final result

Media LED Spheres in the interior

Media LED Spheres in the interior during the day

Media LED Spheres in the interior at night

Front of the business center building

Media LED Spheres in the interior during the day

Media LED Spheres in the interior at night

Full project review - UNK corporate interiors, Officenext

title: the sunshine
titlettemple: Creating a 3D model and poster in the style of cartoons from the Pixar Animation Studios
content:
Target: Creating a 3D model and poster in the style of cartoons from the Pixar Animation Studios. The personage should be similar in appearance and character to the client's daughter. The main requirements are beach sand, bright lighting, a happy expression, balloons, shells, starfish...

Software: Zbrush, Blender, Adobe Photoshop

working process

The first step was to find a reference photo of the client's daughter and sketch her face and body in a cartoonish way. I used a software called Blender to create the 3D model and applied some basic materials and textures to it. I also added some hair and clothing details to make her look more realistic.

Created 3D model (Blender)

Adding armature, hair, eyes, eyebrows, teeth and more ditals (Blender)

The next step was to create the beach scene for the poster. I used a plane for the sand and added some noise and bump maps to give it some roughness and variation. I also added some shells and starfish models.

Created texures from texure paint (Blender)

Add more detals (Blender)

final result

The final step was to add some balloons and pose the character in a happy expression. I used a curve modifier to make the balloons look like they are floating in the air and attached them to the character's hand with a string. I also adjusted the facial features and body posture of the character to make her look cheerful and excited.
